bug.summary: [Bug] probe_vectors should NOT be unit norm functions/_inv_quad_log_det.py?
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h1>üêõ Bug</denchmark-h>
In functions/_inv_quad_log_det.py I see that probe_vectors are set to unit norm:
probe_vectors = probe_vectors.div(probe_vector_norms)
and, as I show below, I think this is a mistake. As in page 4 of Gardner et al, 2018, suppose I want to estimate the trace of the identity matrix I_m in R^m and that A is an invertible matrix in R^{nxn}. Then: Tr(I_m) = Tr(AxA^{-1}) ~ 1/t \sum_{i=1}^t z_i^T A A^{-1} z_i = = 1/t \sum_{i=1}^t z_i^T z_i = (because z_i unit norm) = 1/t \sum_{i=1}^t 1 = 1 But Tr(I_m) equals m.

comments.comment: In the first line after Equation r in Gardner et al., 2018 it says: "is an unbiased estimation of the derivative." but I guess it should say "is an unbiased estimation of the trace." Correct? or am I missing something?

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/joacorapela>@joacorapela</denchmark-link> It's so that the projection of the probe vector on to the Krylov subspace Q'z is e_1 rather than ||z||e_1. See e.g. algorithm 1 <denchmark-link:https://www-users.cs.umn.edu/~saad/PDF/ys-2016-04.pdf>here</denchmark-link> . Note that in the backward pass we remultiply by the probe vector norm because there we directly do a trace estimate and need the vectors unnormalized:
Both the trace estimate and the gradient estimate are unbiased, so I suppose either would work there.
